scummy adjective
(OF WATER ETC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Scummy water or another liquid is covered with a layer of an unpleasant substance: a scummy pool
More examplesFewer examplesOxygen levels can plunge, killing fish and making the water smelly and scummy.Children should especially be kept from entering scummy water since they are more likely than adults to ingest the water.Skim off any scummy substance that rises to the top.

scummy adjective
(DIRTY)
informal unpleasant and dirty or in bad condition: a scummy part of town
More examplesFewer examplesI threw on some scummy jeans and a T-shirt. The toothbrush sits in a scummy holder on a dirty bathroom countertop. He'd taken us all to a scummy wine bar in Chalk Farm. Old scummy goggles are not proper protection.Our room is scummy and old and smells funny.
